result.execSummary:
The defendant Wakeem Lupe Cardenas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction.  Court will allow good time.  Credit for 87 days time served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Restitution set at zero. Court advised defendant of sex offender registry requirements.

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wakeem Lupe Cardenas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wakeem Lupe Cardenas in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Wakeem Lupe Cardenas in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements.

Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court, defendant Wakeem Lupe Cardenas not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel has not received an offer from the State and requests an additional final pretrial date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/20/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Motion in Limine filed by the defense received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Bail remains the same.

Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court, defendant Wakeem Lupe Cardenas not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston on behalf of Cindy Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery from the State but not an offer and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Parties to file motions by 6/05/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court, defendant Wakeem Lupe Cardenas not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared via phone for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery but not an offer from the State and requests an adjourned scheduling date. State does not object. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: JIG (dob: 9/5/1997); Jean G
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Wakeem Lupe Cardenas in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Wakeem Lupe Cardenas in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Wakeem Lupe Cardenas
Current: 1644 S 3rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 04-22-2015)
Prior: 4418 West Meinecke Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
